name: Greenwood Guest House

reviews.title: Sublime mushrooms!
reviews.text: If you're travelling to Weymouth or the south coast I defy anyone to find a cosier, more welcoming B+B than this one. The couple that own it couldn't do enough to make myself and my friend feel at home but didn't ever cross that fine line to become creepy or intrusive - you just knew they would be happy to help if there was anything you needed. The room was extremely comfortable and well maintained, the place very well situated and the breakfast hearty and freshly cooked (the mushrooms were especially good!). My previous experience with staying at B+B's has often been either slightly depressing surroundings or the feeling that you were somehow intruding on someone's private space but I didn't get either impression here.

We are on our way home after a 3 day stay at Greenwood Guest House. We had a brilliant time and we will definitely be returning. The rooms were immaculately clean, the breakfast was delicious, and the location was fantastic.
reviews.title: Perfect - a truely super stay!

reviews.text: Sharon and Angela made our stay so enjoyable - they were brilliant hostesses who were extremely friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Warm welcome, helpful owner, great breakfast, comfortable room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely be returning to Greenwood Guest House, and will also be recommending it to family and friends.
reviews.title: Always a warm welcome
MOST RELAXING AND COMFORTABLE B & B IN WEYMOUTH

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for four nights in the family room as other rooms full. Everything that's been written about the hosts, breakfast, cleanliness and quality of rooms is correct, this is a top notch b and b with a warm welcome, and just outside the centre so quiet in the evening, which I can't imagine other b and b's in the centre are. Easy walking distance into town, we never used the car once to get around Weymouth. Rodwell trail about a minute away, and a really nice walk into Portland., Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Angela and Sharon are great hosts they run a clean, comfy, friendly B&B with an excellent breakfast.
reviews.title: A little gem.

reviews.text: Close to the town and beach.
reviews.title: Great location for everything Weymouth has to offer.

reviews.text: Already stayed there three times and would recomend to everyone
reviews.title: Marvellous Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I chose this B&B based on the good reviews we had read on this site. We arrived later than expected due to being help up, but the owner, Sharon, gave us a very warm welcome. As we were the only guests in for the weekend, she very kindly upgraded us to the biggest room, for no extra charge. The room was spacious and nicely decorated and was spotlessly clean. Bed linen was also lovely and fresh and we both enjoyed a high quality, fresh breakfast on both mornings. Sharon was so helpful in giving us advice on the area and where to visit and to eat in the evening. We followed her advice and read the guides and maps she lent us, and saw some amazing sights followed by a beautiful meal in a fantastic French restaurant ('The Crow's Nest' ) which was the perfect birthday meal for me! This guest house is a little gem and we would definitely stay here again. Thank you Sharon and Angela!
reviews.title: Very friendly, warm welcome in spotless B&B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in September 2008 & 2010 and on both occasions had a lovely time. The B&B is situated a short easy walk from the town, beach and harbour with, whilst being along a peaceful side street. All rooms are very clean, tidy and pleasantly decorated. Breakfast was delicious with all my requests catered for. Parking was fine with a space always available. Wil definatly stay here again in the future. Thank you.
reviews.title: Fantastic, freindly, clean, happy b&b with great owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here on the basis of the trip advisor reviews during the bank holiday weekend and we we were not disappointed! On our arrival we were met by the owners who had made sure they were in especially so that they could meet and greet us, which was a nice touch. The owner made us feel very welcome and gave us a rundown of the local area and all the nice restaurants, the room was very clean and we had a nice view of the garden. The beds were comfortable even if we were a tad late in booking and we ended up with a twin room (the owner had very kindly pushed them together for us). The breakfasts were well cooked (to order as well, my pregnant girlfriend had to have her eggs well done) and I would strongly recommend the homemade jam! The location was good, it was about a 15 minute walk to the beach but you could make it a 30 minute walk and have a nice walk around the marina. If your looking for a friendly, comfortable B n B I could not recommend Greenwood enough!
reviews.title: Lovely Stay, Lovely People

reviews.text: Thanks Sharon and Ange for another great weekend.
reviews.title: Another top weekend!

reviews.text: Room spotless (as ever), great hospitality (as ever...above and beyond the call...!), can't fault anything (as ever...!).
reviews.title: Home from Home
Clean & simple
reviews.text: Recently stayed with my partner. Asked for the family room as it has a decent sized tv in it which was worth the extra £10. Room was basic but fine. VERY CLEAN!! Hosts were nice and friendly and approachable with questions. Great full English. My partner thought it was average. Difference of opinion i guess.

Very easy to park and walk into town. I had slight concerns with the location as on arrival there were a few rough people hanging around (drunks), but there was no noise at night. Whether that would be the case for a Saturday night I'm not so sure.
reviews.title: great b and b

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In a quiet side-street, handily placed for the town-centre, this is a friendly, welcoming place. The room was comfortable (I was given an upgrade) and the breakfast very tasty. Sharon knows just how to make a guesthouse feel like a homestay.
reviews.title: Fantastic & we will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at the greenwood b+b,Once again we had a lovely warm welcome. Our room was a double with an en suite which we found to be spacious and very clean, we had beautiful bedding and lovely towels, To be honest we found this b+b to be one of the best if not the best we have stayed in during our visits to weymouth, The breakfast was fantastic, Also we liked the fact that there is plenty of parking. we our looking forward to our next stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B

description: Small friendly B&B located a short walk from Weymouth town centre, seafront and harbour. Also ideal for visitors to Portland.Just minutes from the Rodwell walking/cycling Trail and Radipole Nature Reserve.Comfortable rooms, all with new wall-mounted flat screen TV's offering over 30 Freeview channels, tea/coffee tray and hairdryers. Free off-road parking and free wi-fi access throughout house.We look forward to welcoming you to Greenwood Guest House.
